III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The new community based treatment program is part of a new addition to the existing
courthouse and secure youth home complex. The entire addition encompasses 15,025
sq. ft. with approximately 7500 sq. ft housing the open residential program. By design,
the new treatment program will segregate the residents in the open program from the
residents in the secure unit.
B. Program Description
The open Residential program components are designed to meet each resident’s
nutritional emotional, spiritual, educational, recreational and physical needs. The
Charlotte Public Schools will provide the educational program. Youth counseling
services are the primary focus of the program. Also, all youth are required to partake in
group counseling 5-7 days per week and issues covered will include but are not limited
to substance abuse, anger management, goal setting, accountability, male and female
issues, relationships, moral reasoning and current events. The treatment modality will
be a blend of cognitive theory and behavior modification and will include a level system.
Parents will be required to take part in counseling and in parenting classes. Also, there
will be aftercare coordinator services provided to both youth and their parents.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
Based on a review of the court-operated facility’s plans to achieve compliance with
applicable rules and statutes, it has been determined that the facility’s plans are
acceptable.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of a provisional certificate of inspection for the Eaton County
Youth Facility Community Based Treatment Program.
